titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Films FA753

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-27 00:08:41 -0400.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains films and video.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 2 business days, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may be restricted from access at the discretion of RAC.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 2: Principle of Genetics Lecture Series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains films originating from Rockefeller University records, as well as various laboratories and the papers of select faculty.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: All inquires to view films require advanced notice of at least 24 hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those not available in modern formats, may be restricted from scholarly access at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film of a meeting between Christian B. Anfinsen (National Institute of Health), Stanford Moore (Rockefeller University), and William H. Stein (Rockefeller University).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: NBC television program from 1966 May about molecular biology, nucleic acids, and the new Merck Building.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: From WABC-TV with reporter Melba Tolliver visiting Dr. Rene Dubos in his RU laboratory and office. Discusses high school and local history, walk through neighborhood with wife Jean Dubos.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: All inquires to view films require advanced notice of at least 24 hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those not available in modern formats, may be restricted from scholarly access at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interview of Dr. Rene Dubos by reporter Earl Ubel (WCBS-TV) at RU campus. Discusses destruction of the environment, mismanagement of urban life, deterioration of the city, child development, effects of pollution on children, and the East River Drive waterfront.

did.physdesc: Sound, black and white films. All begin with 60 seconds of color bars and tone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A series of 48 films on Principles of Genetics, organized by Dr. Irwin H. Herskowitz, Saint Louis University. Presented by McGraw-Hill Text-Films. Supported by a grant from The Fund for the Advancement of Education to Educational Station KETC-TV and Saint Louis University.Produced by University Films. Destributed by McGraw-Hill Book Company Text-Film Department.
